args:
The party is able to enter the village thanks
to a priestess named Akasha, who serves the
Church-of-All. There, they find many people
seeking the blessing of a mysterious dragon
called Hastur. Later that night, the party
lays eyes upon a most miraculous sight.
Be gone... Be gone... Be gone...
If you would bring harm to the village,\ndeparture or removal are your choices...
Okay, everyone slow down. We just need\nto find an inn for this sick little girl.
No mercy to thieves... Be gone...
Are you people so on guard against\nthievery that you accuse any random\npassers-by of coveting your belongings?
If so, there must be valuable treasure\nindeed hidden within this village.
Heinwald? Don't want to be a mother hen\nhere, but THIS IS NOT THE TIME TO BE\nPROVOKING THESE PEOPLE!
Thieves... Brigands come to steal away\nthe blessings of our great Lord Hastur,\nthe King in Yellow... No mercy unto you...
Hmm. What is to be done here...?
Everyone, would you deign to think\ncarefully about this?
A beast starved of sustenance will bare\nits fangs at far more than just prey if it\nthinks doing so will lead to survival.
The blessings of Hastur are given to those\nwho desire it from the utmost depths of\ntheir hearts.
We of the Church-of-All have no cause\nto refuse the desirous.
Pray forgive us this trespass, travelers.\nI bid you welcome to our humble village\nof Teinsom.
You have our thanks, my lady.\nOr should we call you Priestess?
My apologies. I am Akasha, and I amâ€”
A priestess of this so-called Church-of-All,\nyeah? Tell me about that, will you?\nTell me aaaall about it.

My, what a scary face. ...We here are no
more than miserable louses, wandering in
search of someone to lean upon. Mere
suppliants, drawn like moths to a flame.
You are an inquisitor, yes? As such,\nwill you not decry us as heretics should\nwe refuse to follow your beloved Ilia?
Heh, I'm not that much of a stickler, \nbut you gotta admit, this place makes\na suspicous impression.
Heh heh. Then perhaps later we can\ndiscuss that which we worship in\nrather...lengthy detail.
That sounds like quite the treat indeed!\nSpeaking with one of your intellect would\ndoubtless be a stimulating experience.
If anything is stimulating, it would be a\nlong, passionate conversation with you...
Yeah, it's great that you're so...uh...into\nmy esteemed colleague here, but maybe\nwe can take this conversation to the inn?
Sadly, this village lacks such lodgings.\nHowever, I may have a solution...

I cannot believe they agreed to lend
us an entire home for our own use.
That being said, it certainly could
use a good dusting...
Meh, we won't be here long anyway.\nMore to the point, how's Lathna?
She should be fine after her rest.\nI expect she'll wake before long.
Well, speak of the devil! How are you\nfeeling there, Lathna?
Because you disappeared without a peep,\nthat's how. And made plenty of trouble\nin the meantime, might I add.
You mustn't come near me! Please!\nYou must forget you ever saw me!
I'm not me! There's something inside\nme that isn't me!
Okay, WHAT are you talking about?
Ah, now THIS is intriguing. Please, go on.\nExpound upon this ï¼‚you who is not youï¼‚\nin greater detail, if you would.
Without realizing it, I... Urgh! No!\nThat is not me!
Let's take this down a notch, Heinwald.\nHer fever is starting to come back.
Oh, posh! The girl is merely overexcited.\nWhat's more importantâ€”and more\nworrisomeâ€”is that of which she spoke.
Something inside her that isn't her, yeah?\nThink she means the ï¼‚We are Chaosï¼‚\nfella from before?
You think that presence is why Lathna\ncame all the way to this village?
You going to share an actual opinion,\nor are you just gonna hum the day away?

You ask me to make assumptions while
working with a paucity of information.
I'll not share mindless speculation on
matters which remain so unclear.
Oh, that is SO you, Heinwald!\nStill, we found Lathna, so I guess\nthat's one box checked.
Mmm. I do hope that's the case.
*CRAAAACK* Uuurgh... I know it beats\nsleeping outside, but this wooden floor\nis NOT doing my back any favors.
Still your whinging and deal with it.\nUnless you prefer making an ill child\nsleep on the floor in your stead?
Some nerve for YOU to say that, pal!\n...Wait, what's going on out there?
Oh, Hastur! Please deliver unto me\nyour sacred blessing!
All hail the King in Yellow!\nAll hail the Unspeakable One!
Implore him with all your heart, for the\nblessings of our shepherd are granted\nonly to those hearts that truly yearn for it!
Our shepherd! Our king! Hastur! HASTUR!

A land of past. Of present. Of future.
From this place I invite you who have
suffered long to a new beginning.
I bestow unto you that which is unnamed.
To you who have passed long years\nenslaved to time, I recognize your desire.
Our King in Yellow grants his blessing.
No, I got that part of it. I was asking\nin more of a ï¼‚WHAT THE HELL IS THIS?!ï¼‚\nkind of way.
The people here seemed to desire this\nblessing above all else. Did they truly\nunderstand what form it would take?
Do you think THIS is the immortal part\nof the Immortal Village? If so, I guess\nI maaaaybe understand it? Sort of?
They are ensnared by eternity. Prisoners\nwho mistook endlessness for an instant.
Can one really call merely observing time\npass ï¼‚eternityï¼‚?
It appears the jailer has harsh words\nfor her prisoners.
I am but a prisoner myself. A bird caged\nby the lord who is great and yet small.
You seem like the type who could chew\nthrough the bars and soar off to freedom.
I am not nearly so powerful as you claim.\nIndeed, I await eagerly the time when\nsomeone comes to free me from my jail.
Might you possess the key? Would you\nrelease me, that we may embark on a\njourney to distant stars together?
Getting propositioned by a beauty like you\nis a rare pleasure indeed.
That said, I'm more a propositioner than\na propositioned-to. But I do still believe\nin the power of love at fist fight!
Oh, but you ARE fascinating people.\nAs such, let me give you a piece of\nadvice as a token of our meeting.
No matter what happens, do not venture\nout at night in this village.
You must protect yourselves if you don't\nwish to become ensnared by this village.

Don't go out at night, eh? She might as
well have flung the door wide herself,
because now I'm VERY curious what will
happen when we do so.
I figured you wouldn't heed that warning.\nThat being said, I'm also a bit curiâ€”
Was that a roar? A beast? No...
Less random guessing, more running out\ninto the dark and seeing what's going on!
